												This is not my normal cup of tea, but I thought I'd give it a go. I was somewhat put off my the earlier reviews, but there are no technical issues for me running on Win 8.1/overclocked i5/GTX760/SSD. It runs beautfully with all settings maxed out.It's a very enjoyable game. I'm still getting the hang of it, but you can turn down the zoom in deaths if that is tiresome and just crack on with zombie mayhem.Great atmosphere, really good fun - you can play for a few hours or just a few minutes. Seriously for the current sale price of Â£4.99, it's a bargain. I just wish the game was better known and had a bigger community. 5/5.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												I went into this game not really knowing what to expect, and ended up pleasantly surprised - it's basically a sniper-focused L4D, and as a result it's pretty dang fun co-op.It's worth mentioning that this game is clearly low-budget and rips environments and some of its level design directly from Sniper Elite V2. Having said that, the game plays noticeably differently than SEV2 - cover no longer matters, and ammo conservation is much, much more important.Definitely worth the 4 bucks I spent on it, though I probably wouldn't have spent much more than that.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
												I wanted to like this, but I just can't make myself.I really liked Sniper Elite V2, and 3, but the zombie versions are not the same at all. These games are best thought of as run and gun shooters, made in a 3rd person engne that is not designed for running and gunning, which happen to contain a few sniping set pieces. The sniping is also annoying as the lurching motion of the zombies makes landing a kill shot harder, which when there's a dozen coming for you from different angles makes the game plain old frustrating.Running and gunning is the majority of the game and is just poorly handled. Sniping is the minority of the action and frequently devloves into running and gunning as the dead get around your position. It's tense, which is probably the best thing you can say for the game, but it feels like your deaths are due to the gameplay rather than your own actions.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
												I wanted to like this, but I just can't make myself.I really liked Sniper Elite V2, and 3, but the zombie versions are not the same at all. These games are best thought of as run and gun shooters, made in a 3rd person engne that is not designed for running and gunning, which happen to contain a few sniping set pieces. The sniping is also annoying as the lurching motion of the zombies makes landing a kill shot harder, which when there's a dozen coming for you from different angles makes the game plain old frustrating.Running and gunning is the majority of the game and is just poorly handled. Sniping is the minority of the action and frequently devloves into running and gunning as the dead get around your position. It's tense, which is probably the best thing you can say for the game, but it feels like your deaths are due to the gameplay rather than your own actions.

content:
Posted: March 18, 2014
												I wish there was a "neutral" option for reviews.. it is a fun game, but it is definitely lacking in some of hopes I had for it, but still a slightly positive game experience.the good:+ decent variety of map layouts and situations+ has a few nice easter-eggs which unfortunately is rare in modern games+ it's sniper elite, enough said about thatthe bad:- I know they're zombies, but their animations and movment could use a LOT of improvement... if they can hold clubs in their hands and some jump from rooftop to rooftop, I think they have the cognitive ability to walk in a straight line (I blame AI pathing programming)- for weapon selections, when it boils down they're all 98% identical, you can choose a springfield of a mosin and it feels the same, your only real choice is bolt or semi-auto. as well as machine gun or shotgun, thats it- for a game with "sniper" in the name, it lacks tactical thinking most of the time, instead of planning out a field of view and multiple routes it's more "I'm going to sit here and plant land mines in ALL the hallways for the horde of 500 zombies then just 360 no-scope them hurr-hurr" sadly, thats what this game is about, hordes of zombies and how much ammo you can burn throughThe Neutral:# finding matches can be a royal pain at times, even when you have the search set to "any"# while it is a fun game, and as much as it pains me to say this Dead Island was a better overall design, however the sale price is good for what it is, a few hours of random shooting funOverall I would give this game a 6/10 it is a decent way to waste an hour or so of boredom, but it's final execution leaves me asking "why?" and wanting to go play Sniper Elite V2 instead. it's a sad day when I choose nazis over zombies.

content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
												Absolutely awesome game. I picked up Nazi Zombie Army 1 & 2 for the recent sale price of Â£4.49, and holy crap that was a good deal. There isnât much that is wrong with this game, itâs incredibly fun, looks beautiful and plays very well. I imagine that this series could carry on with more games, and I assume that it will. I played this game along with 2 of my friends, and at times it was difficult. Currently I am playing through the first game and OMG it is hard. Ammo is scarce and you really worry when youâre running low and you have a load of zombies in your path. I assume that the second is no different. The story is somewhat lacking, when playing through it didnât feel like there was much point, it doesnât really force the story upon you. Even in the cut scenes none of the characters talk. Which is very odd. I hope that future games will have a bit more of an immersive story. Huge recommendation, while there is no real story the gameplay alone is extremely satisfying.Especially for the low price.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												While this is closer to a run and gun shooter game rather than the Sniper Elite series, the mechanics are the same but the game play is completely opposite. Overall, it is a spooky game and that is cool. However, one MAJOR annoyance is the black screens. When I load the game, I get no menus. I can use my up and down arrows and I hear it changing the selections. That is the only way I can get the game to load. It seems to play OK once it is loaded. I have tried everything I can think of to fix it and for one evening it worked, but I have been unable to duplicate it. Perhaps my PC is too new for it. I am running GTX980's in 3 way SLI, 8 core processor, and 32 GB of ram viewed on a 28" 4k monitor. Do I recommend the game? Hmm, that is a tough one. For someone like myself that usually plays solo, the waves of baddies from every direction causes me to turn around and around to make sure nothing is sneaking up on me. This starts to cause motion sickness which is something I rarely experienced in the Sniper Elite series. I am going to say no, I would not recommend it. If, and only if, they fix that black screen issue (which seems to be fairly common) then perhaps I will change it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 13, 2015
												Sniper Elite: nazi Zombie Army 2 is the first full game of Sniper Elite that i played (i played SE v2 demo but it was few years ago :P) and i must say that i love this game. Now sometimes the game can make you rage, swear and curse creators of the game, but after few tries you realise what did you do wrong, and you fix your mistake, and then progress with a "banana" on your face.Gameplay :   This version is kinda varied from other Sniper Elite games. Mainly because you wont use your sniper rifle that often. Another diffrence, is that you actually shoot zombies, that melee you, instead of shooting enemies. Well, there are Zombie Snipers, that kinda sounds stupid and unrealistic, but i'll explain that later. I really like the balance between needing to use your sniper, and full options to use any weapon you want.Story (NO SPOILERS) :   We start with a cutscene of Hitler speaking to one of his generals (i couldnt identify him closely, but that doesnt really matter) about the Relics that supposed to keep the zombies in control. We get to know that Nazis had some Relics that let them control these zombies. Our mission is to get in the possesion of those, and stop the Nazi Zombies. As simple as it gets, i dont play the game too much for the story. The story isnt anything super great, but i dont mind it.Realism :  Now I could even dig it that Nazis got some super zombie virus that let them to take over the whole Europe or something, but they got some magical relics, that control zombies. What is that ? I mean i dont hate it, but you could atleast implement some more realism in that part. The only thing that i understand about that, because it actually matches the story, is the Zombie Snipers i mentioned before. I mean, they can somehow fly, but i guess creators though of him being somehow powered by magic of the relics or something like that. They are kinda annoying because, you scope in, and they jump to another position, but i guess it is supposed to be the diffrence from other games.Difficulty :   I am playing this game on the hardest difficulty, and i must say that it isn't that hard as i expected but in some parts It can get frustrating. I guess i could finish the game on easiest in about 4-5 hours. As i read some other people's reviews, they finished on hardest in about 9-10 hours, I didnt finish the story yet (writing this at Friday, the 13th) but i guess im gonna have a time around that, maybe even faster.Pros :+Balanced difficulty+A good variancy from other Sniper Elite games+Good gameplay+Nice Graphics+Sound effects are good+Bullet cams are cool as alwaysCons :-Not that realistic as expected-Zombie Snipers are more annoying than challenging-No local cooperation modeOverall : 7.5/10

content:
Posted: January 3
												   Where do i begin with whats worng with this game. First off it still rips off all the maps from Sniper Elite V2 and the only thing new is that you changed the graphics on the map to make it look more spokey. Second this game is still set up as if it was a sniping game instead of a Close Quarter Combat game which it real is. Third the zombies seem to twitch when the move around so head shots are very hard to make especially since you have to run around a lot, because if you crouch walk through this whole game your good as dead. Forth and related to the thrid and second point if the zombies get within 10inc infront of you they will star trying to hit you which increases there spead and makes it hard to hit them especially if they are already on top of you. Fith the ammo in this game is like a diamond in minecraft very hard to find unless you souly rely on your pistol and rifle as SMG ammo is hard to find, and when you find the shotgun ammo will extremely hard to find, wich sucks since the shotgun is the best gun to use. Sixth the mini boss zombies can only be killed by head shots which returning back to point two, three, and four getting your heart beat to slow down enough to make perfect head shots is extremely hard especially when they can shoot back or turn every zombie around you into a flaming zombie on steroids. Seventh the shotgun takes longer to load than it should and with the Revolver it should take half the amount of time since the ammo you pick up is in a speed loader, yet he manually loads every single round (I was hoping that in this instalment of the game they would fix that). Finaly this game is set up to be 4 players and even the single playre mode treats it as if you had 4 people or even 1 other person playing with you.      I have played a lot of zombie games including inde zombie games, but never have i feelt so disapointed in a zombie game since Day Z came out. This series is now one of the worst zombie games I have ever played.     So in conclusion dont buy this game its a complete rip off and will stress you out majorly that is unless you can actualy find someone to play with you then it may be a little more easy, but it still isnt worth your money.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 28, 2014
												What a fantastic Zombie horde survival game...If you are wondering what this game is...it is exactly like Left 4 Dead, as you and a group of other players will traverse across the stage, killing zombies, finding safe rooms, finding checkpoints, and at the end of each level there's some sort of boss.I however, enjoy this game more than Left 4 Dead. There's no real plot or narrative besides Hitler unleashing his "Nazi Zombies", shortly dying after by his own creation, and you are set out to find the mysterious relics when which combines destroy all the zombies.But... the game isn't focused on story at all, rather it focuses on pure gameplay, and fun. The level design is so gothic, and gruesome. The zombies are slow moving, and are pretty realistic as most only go down with headshots...This is where the "Sniper Elite" part comes into play, as you are not able to mow down zombies with sub machines guns without running out of ammo. Therefor, you end up using your sniper A LOT, and must rely on your ability to get headshots at a distance, otherwise the zombie hords will overwhelm you.Like other Sniper Elite games, when sniping zombies from a long-distance you will go into a "slow-mo" instant replay showing where the bullets hit, and how they break through the zombies insides. Unfortunetely.... this is only really shown in Single Player, considering the game has to slow down in order to show you the replay. In multiplayer it does happen, but is very quick, and often not as rewarding.As for gameplay, this is a 3rd person shooter, but while aiming with the sniper you go into a first-person sniper scope. It's an interesting mechanic which isn't quite as good as Call of Duty's World at War / Black Ops Zombies, but it does the job quite nicely and is a more challenging game then the easy child's play game of Left 4 Dead.----------------The few downsides I saw were pretty minimal complaints...- There's no power-ups- Not many things to find or collect- Levels are very linear, like a rail shooter. (very scripted)- Searching Zombie Bodies for Ammo takes far too long. (should be automatic pickups)- No unique guns / items / melee weapons to find. (typically you have just 3 standard guns)- Single Player feels a bit "too difficult", and "too long" since you have to kill all the zombies alone.- Lack of Story / Direction (often I forgot where I was going, or what the goal was)------------I paid: $2.30Would definitely suggest this game to anyone who enjoys zombie horde survival games.

												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

												Experience a terrifyingly intense co-op campaign for up to four players in this gut-wrenching sequel to Steam best-seller, Sniper Elite: Nazi Zombie Army. With World War 2 Europe overrun by legions of the undead, you must find mankindâs salvation deep in the twisted bowels of Berlin by securing the sacred artefacts that unleashed this damnation. Every step must be paid in blood as players work together against impossible odds and descend further into the demon-infested city and the terrifying FÃ¼hrerbunker itself. Tackle the campaign online in co-op for up to four players, or embark on the twisted missions alone if youâve got the bottle. Featuring new enemies, new environments, blood curdling surprises and the return of the infamous X-ray kill cam, Sniper Elite: Nazi Zombie Army 2 will satisfy even the most bloodthirsty of zombie hunters.

Posted: April 10, 2014
												DO NOT believe the metacritic rating. This game is an excellent game that does exactly what it sets out to do: Allow you to blow the heads off Nazi Zombies. Much like the first game, the weapons are varied enough despite their initial similar appearances. I can only imagine how identical all of these rifles look to a layman. Despite that, they offer enough variety and are, quite surprisingly, EXTREMELY well balanced. There is no one loadout that breaks the game, nor any that is useless. Between me and my three teammates, we all chose totally different sets of gear. One of us chose a long-range, bolt-action rifle with a high powered scope, two of us more medium-flavored but with totally different secondary weapons and the fourth (me) with a VERY short-range carbine and shotgun. They all work and are all a barrel of fun. The maps are MUCH MUCH MUCH more varied than the first game with some interesting set-pieces that really added to the game. They are gimmicks on the surface, but I thought they were cool. One thing to note is the difference in maps from NZA1 to NZA2. The first was very open 90% of the time, with only the occasional really close-in tense fights, focusing more on massive hordes than proximity. The second was practically the opposite. Almost totally close-in and with few distant engagements. With those in mind, think of NZA1 and NZA2 as the same game with some good variety and differences between the two. Both are quite good at what they do and deserve praise for it. When they go on sale, buy 'em. They're still a lot of fun on your own, too. DO IT.

Posted: October 29, 2014
												Sniper Elite: Nazi Zombie Army 2 is a third person shooter game. It is a zombie game which continues the story of Sniper Elite: Nazi Zombie Army (senza). This game is quite similar to senza 1, it just continues the story and improves a little bit of graphic issues, the rest stays the same. You have 4 characters, one of which is the protagonist of Sniper Elite 3, you will try to collect all the fragments with 0-3 players and escape Berlin.  This game contains a lot of blood and gore, but it gives the players a good feeling each time the players make a headshot, and is sometimes challenging to fight at the same time the Panzer soldier (the small boss) while trying to kill other zombies around him at the same time. However, I found this game not terrifying while it does give us an atmosphere of fear, this can be good (or bad) for the players trying to play through the campaign.I recommend this to all the fans of senza 1.Positive remarks+graphic improvement+story continuing+only talents and accuracy, no camping Negative remarks-doesn't have big changes in comparison with senza 1I think that's it, nothing much more to say.

												This is a wicked game to play. Like the first game (which I own) it has great graphics, an interesting story line and wave upon wave of zombies for you to kill! As with the first game it does sadly have a habbit of being glitchy here and there, especially when you get into a safe room the framerate disapears into nothingness but as soon as your back outside of it the game runs awesomely again. I have checked this with friends whilst playing co-op and they get the same issues in the exact same places so I am confident that it is a game issue. In conclusion, this game is great and I hightly recommend it to anyone. Additionally, if you've not already, get yourself the first game and play it through as this game does follow on from the first and they are both worth the money, especially when playing with friends. Great game! Hoping to see a third edition real soon! ;)

Posted: March 3, 2014
												This game is really REALLY awesome. It's kinda like Killing Floor but on a much larger scale. The graphics are really good compared to the price. Single player is fun, but multiplayer is really where it's at playing with other people. Single player is good for practicing and if you're interested in the story line at all.I only have two complaints: First, the servers can be abit glitchy and laggy. If you've got a good team of 4, then it shouldn't pose as much of a problem. If they are all in your face, well, prepare to die and hopefully a team mate can heal you up.Second: Mission length. I wasn't sure if it actually saved at a check point or not, but the very first mission in the game was almost an hour long. I admit taking a breather every so often at a save room, but really, this is just too long for a casual game. Multiplayer missions aren't as bad, but do plan on being at the computer for awhile during a match.Other then those two complaints, the game overall is great. A very minor complaint is although the "Matrix" slowomo stuff is cool, it does get old, especially if you prefer to be a sniper like I do. Overall, for how much the game is, and the entertainment it provides, I highly suggest you try it out. See ya in game.

												Ignore the rating, it's entierly unture. This game, though it's story is linear, and simple. Characters awkwardly slinet during Cutscenes, makes up for it with amazing graphical detail. Advanced sniping mechanics, and an all out enjoyable atmosphere. You almost wish it was open world, as the game itself does a nice job of seeming realistic rather than a run'n'gun shooter. Their faces, guts, necks, hips, and so on and so forth. If you liked the zombie mode in Black Ops 1 and 2 then you might be ready for this game. This game is for the more refind zombie killers, you know for the people that take pride in how they kill zombies and watch them be ripped to pieces with bullets, and bombs. Enjoy the X-ray shots as you scope out the kill 400 yards away and get to see the bullet pierce the eye sockets and continue to make a nice exit out the back of the skull of your mark. If you can handle the killing, enjoy this master piece of art.

												Coming out as a sequel, rather than a dlc or expansion, comes Sniper Elite; Nazi Zombie Army 2.Following the same path, SENZA2 put 1-4 players against what is left of Europe after the Nazis used a supernatural artifact to reanimate their lost forces. Posted: March 3, 2014
												This game is really REALLY awesome. It's kinda like Killing Floor but on a much larger scale. The graphics are really good compared to the price. Single player is fun, but multiplayer is really where it's at playing with other people. Single player is good for practicing and if you're interested in the story line at all.I only have two complaints: First, the servers can be abit glitchy and laggy. If you've got a good team of 4, then it shouldn't pose as much of a problem. If they are all in your face, well, prepare to die and hopefully a team mate can heal you up.Second: Mission length. I wasn't sure if it actually saved at a check point or not, but the very first mission in the game was almost an hour long. I admit taking a breather every so often at a save room, but really, this is just too long for a casual game. Multiplayer missions aren't as bad, but do plan on being at the computer for awhile during a match.Other then those two complaints, the game overall is great. A very minor complaint is although the "Matrix" slowomo stuff is cool, it does get old, especially if you prefer to be a sniper like I do. Overall, for how much the game is, and the entertainment it provides, I highly suggest you try it out. See ya in game.

Posted: July 21, 2015
												hmmm where to starrrtt... ok. NZA2 is a thirdperson shooter set in apocolyptic Berlin, Germany. Basically this what used to be an expansion now a standalone game answers the question "What if Hitler had suceeded in raising demons using Satanic Rituals to help him win the war?" Zombies carry weapons, some even have Sniper Rifles, and it is very likely you will die on the easiest difficulty settings. Fun singleplayer and very fun multiplayer campaign. There are about 6 hours od singleplayer and 5 of Co op campaign and non stop gore.  all in all a very good game for its price.

Posted: May 16, 2015
												Sniper Elite: Nazi Zombie Army 2 is the sequel to the critically acclaimed kind-of-okay-i-guess Sniper Elite: Nazi Zombie Army which was renowned for being, well, average. It used mechanics from the other Sniper Elite games and added less alive nazis and more undead ones. The grim, gloomy atmosphere and fantastic ambient sound really added to the "last man/men alive" feel. The Co-op shooter could get dull however, with little to no varying game mechanics to be seen after unlocking and equipping a few different guns, its sequel may has well have been a DLC expansion to the original.Overall? I'd recommend it to anyone with friends to play it with which is why I probably didn't enjoy it.....

You want to show your sniping skills are not limited to the 100+ meter range on no more than ten Krauts at one time? Whip out the sniper rifle; it's time to shatter some skulls with Rebellion's awesome kill cam! And no mater what style you picked, you can still get together with friends and survive the Apocalypse with buddies. Seriously: you can pick what kind of game you want to play and play it, without being restricted to just machine guns, or just sniper rifles. It's time to kickâ¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥for the Lord. Posted: January 13, 2014
												The general premise is "shoot zombies, make it to the safe room," just like L4D.  There aren't many improvements over the first NZA game - in fact, it uses mostly the same maps (some taken from Sniper Elite V2, others taken from NZA 1), and uses the same final boss.  So in that regard, it was clearly phoned in.  But on the other hand, I can't deny how fun it is.  Sniping zombies didn't get old in the 3.5 hrs it took me to play the 5 levels of the campaign.  The controls are tight, I didn't run into any glitches, and the first level was beautiful in it's hellish look.  If you're deciding which to pick up, I'd get the first NZA game, but if you liked that one, this gives you more of the same.

												now, I was mad at first because as I got excited and boot it for the first time after beating the first one, I realized practially everything within this game, just pulls from the first game, I've yet to find a weapon that wasn't in the first game, but.. I still cant hate it, the atmosphere, the new levels, added scare jumps that made me and my friend jump out of her skin from the ongoing terror and tension. (which was hilarious.)it holds true to the same goal of the last game, trying to stop the evil by seemingly running from safe room to saferoom while you and your friends get your asses handed to you by the super zombies and skeletions (the the klaking of they're bones from a distance freaked out me and my friends.)With all the fun and excitement I had, there is a few things I did find annoying, like the old game, it still had a bit of a problem where, no matter what, when looking through the scope, the game can get a bit laggy, so much that at one point the amount of zombies on screen made it impossible to scope and shoot to the point I had to waist shoot them (and did rather amazingly at it)my only big argument with this game is that it needs some regular rifles that have no scopes so I can have the ability to aim at close enemies with my rifle, instead of staring into the distance while they pumble me into the ground.

Posted: November 2, 2014
Fun game for the priceI have finished both Nazi Zombie Army 1 & 2 and enjoyed them. However, this game didn't offer anything new, except levels, and a lot was taken from Sniper Elite v2.I was expecting new weapons, items, etc...but was let down. The difficulty has also been a constant problem with this series. Players just found this game to be too easy, even on Sniper Elite difficulty. An enemy multiplier option was added to help with this, but it just feels more like a band-aid approach. Sure, shooting MORE zombies sounds fun, but it makes the game feel very monotonous. Still, it is a great game for the price and offers in-game hosting to boot.

												hmmm where to starrrtt... ok. NZA2 is a thirdperson shooter set in apocolyptic Berlin, Germany. Basically this what used to be an expansion now a standalone game answers the question "What if Hitler had suceeded in raising demons using Satanic Rituals to help him win the war?" Zombies carry weapons, some even have Sniper Rifles, and it is very likely you will die on the easiest difficulty settings. Fun singleplayer and very fun multiplayer campaign. There are about 6 hours od singleplayer and 5 of Co op campaign and non stop gore.  all in all a very good game for its price.

Posted: July 3, 2016
												So, i am sort of a zombie video game snob, from CoD WaW, to black ops 3, i play left 4 dead one and two, i play how to survive, and i have played many other zombie games, but personally i have to agree with many people when i say this game  is a definite fun game, however short the campaign may be its still a fun game to play with friends just to mess around with, it kind of reminds me of zombies in WaW except with more moving around rather than staying in one place, i like how it spices things up by adding in zombies that shoot at you and some that kamakazie you, rather than just staying your basic zombie game, i also like how the game affords you all the weaponry you could want instead of having to stick to a basic loadout and damn near die with no ammo around, there are plenty of explosions to be had, plenty of bullets to be shot, and plenty of zombies to kill, these zombies specficily arent an easy thing to fight up close, they do great damage, but they arent over powered either, these zombies have got to be my favoriate, this game really sticks to how to kill a zombie just pop a round into the heart or head (zombies gotta have the heart to pump blood to the brain),which i right off the bat loved, i like how they also included the option of having the bullet cams still i loved those in the previoius games and love them in this one. the game doesnt need a beefy computer to run the program but it would help probably i have a basic laptop incapable of running some of the regular ones like sniper elite v3 for instance, but runs this perfectly, defitnily worth the 4.49 i paid for it, love every second of the game so far, the only complaint i have is that if you dont have a friend already to play with, its hard to find an online multiplayer match, because not many people play the multiplayer, so far as i know, but other than that fantastic zombie game, great graphics, great gore, grade A game, definitly not for serioiusness though as someone else stated, this is one of those games you play to shoot up zombies, blow up stuff, and have  laughs, and good fun! Thats about it for me, add me if you want to play some of this with someone else xD, enjoy this amazing game.

Posted: October 29, 2014
												Sniper Elite: Nazi Zombie Army 2 is a third person shooter game. It is a zombie game which continues the story of Sniper Elite: Nazi Zombie Army (senza). This game is quite similar to senza 1, it just continues the story and improves a little bit of graphic issues, the rest stays the same. You have 4 characters, one of which is the protagonist of Sniper Elite 3, you will try to collect all the fragments with 0-3 players and escape Berlin.  This game contains a lot of blood and gore, but it gives the players a good feeling each time the players make a headshot, and is sometimes challenging to fight at the same time the Panzer soldier (the small boss) while trying to kill other zombies around him at the same time. However, I found this game not terrifying while it does give us an atmosphere of fear, this can be good (or bad) for the players trying to play through the campaign.I recommend this to all the fans of senza 1.Positive remarks+graphic improvement+story continuing+only talents and accuracy, no camping Negative remarks-doesn't have big changes in comparison with senza 1I think that's it, nothing much more to say.

												This is a good game. While it is most certainly is no godsend, it's a solid game.PROS+Awesome sinper mechanic+Large variety of WW2 weapons+Decent challenge for those who like more difficult games+Can be played without playing the first game+Good gunplay and action+Game looks pretty goodCONS-Game is pretty short (9-12 hours long)-Storyline is really basic and there really is not any sort of character development-Gameplay gets somewhat repetative-Lame final bossOverall I think this is definetly a good game to buy if you see it on sale someday. RATING: 7.2/10

Posted: January 27, 2015
												Pros- Graphics are great- Atmosphere and creepiness factors are off the charts- The controls are good, and it works perfectly with an Xbox 360 wireless controllerCons- 3rd person perspective makes environmental objects obstruct the camera from time to time- 3rd person perspective makes all the guns feel the same (with the exception of the sniper rifle which actually aims down the sights)- Just in gneral this feels like a great game that needs to be in 1st person rather than 3rd.End verdict: Buy it on sale, when it's worth it!

Posted: July 3, 2016
												So, i am sort of a zombie video game snob, from CoD WaW, to black ops 3, i play left 4 dead one and two, i play how to survive, and i have played many other zombie games, but personally i have to agree with many people when i say this game  is a definite fun game, however short the campaign may be its still a fun game to play with friends just to mess around with, it kind of reminds me of zombies in WaW except with more moving around rather than staying in one place, i like how it spices things up by adding in zombies that shoot at you and some that kamakazie you, rather than just staying your basic zombie game, i also like how the game affords you all the weaponry you could want instead of having to stick to a basic loadout and damn near die with no ammo around, there are plenty of explosions to be had, plenty of bullets to be shot, and plenty of zombies to kill, these zombies specficily arent an easy thing to fight up close, they do great damage, but they arent over powered either, these zombies have got to be my favoriate, this game really sticks to how to kill a zombie just pop a round into the heart or head (zombies gotta have the heart to pump blood to the brain),which i right off the bat loved, i like how they also included the option of having the bullet cams still i loved those in the previoius games and love them in this one. the game doesnt need a beefy computer to run the program but it would help probably i have a basic laptop incapable of running some of the regular ones like sniper elite v3 for instance, but runs this perfectly, defitnily worth the 4.49 i paid for it, love every second of the game so far, the only complaint i have is that if you dont have a friend already to play with, its hard to find an online multiplayer match, because not many people play the multiplayer, so far as i know, but other than that fantastic zombie game, great graphics, great gore, grade A game, definitly not for serioiusness though as someone else stated, this is one of those games you play to shoot up zombies, blow up stuff, and have  laughs, and good fun! Thats about it for me, add me if you want to play some of this with someone else xD, enjoy this amazing game.

Posted: March 7, 2014
												Good game, really recommend it if you played the first one, it's better in almost every aspects. They really improved on the sniper experience and upgraded the graphics alot too.Ofcourse it's your typical zombie FPS shooter, only with a twist (third person view) and your sniping them most of the time. You also find yourself trying to headshot alot because the zombies can revive themselves if you kill them without a headshot. There are different types of zombies and you have different strategies for defeating them.Overall an awesome shooter, which gives a twist to the typical zombie games.

Posted: May 9, 2016
												Good games to have 1 & 2 together they make a full game lol both are short lived when played so together consider them a whole game but co-op side is nice n fun keep you and few buddies happy for 14hrs me and my brother beat both in 14hrs and 7hrs respectivly we restarted few levels so give or take its a 12 hr for 1 and 7hrs for the 2nd with 2 people on easy i think we played so harder difficulties might extend it's life. either way both 1 & 2 are worth playing. Wanna give warning if you get triolgy you can not play with people that have the single copies that comes from a dev so just toss that out there for yaz.

Posted: May 30, 2014
												Well, I can't say that I would recommend this game to everyone, but I must admit that I didn't expect it to be so attractive, it entertained me for almost 14 hours.Pros and cons:+ Atmosphere of good old trashy grindhouse movies (ZOMBE NAZIES â¥â¥â¥â¥ YEAH, green fog everywhere, terrifying voices and absolutely â¥â¥â¥â¥ed music (it's a compliment)+ Fancy graphics+ Easy and funny achievements+ YOU CAN KILL HITLER (It was Hitler, right?)- Terrible optimization (no, it's not just "terrible", it's â¥â¥â¥â¥ING TERRIBLE)- Terrible unstable and abandoned co-op. Better play it with 1-2 friends. And don't even think of playing it alone, it kills half of the fun.To sum up, game is totally worth it's price when it is on sale (2 bucks in my country). If you can overcome all its drawbacks, you will enjoy it, I guarantee.

Posted: August 26, 2016
												First of all I love Zombies... I had enjoyed the Left for dead and call of duty zombies, but this is the one i like the best.  This is the closest to the Romero vision of zombies.  Even the music sounds like its straight out of the movies he has done.  I love the sniper cam.  I got the trilogy for my son on his Xbox one, and i got this for my pc.  It took an hour to adjust to the mouse/keyboard way, but in little time i was hitting most everything i shot.  This game would have been way more popular if more people knew about it.  I saw that metacritic only gave it a 53/100, i want to punch them in the face!  Again I love zombies, and also WW2 weapons.  I love this game!

Posted: July 2, 2015
												Quite fun game to play, 6,5/10Pros: + Quite good graphics, same good as in NZA1.+ 5 new chapters, story of NZA1 continues, in my opinion this has better chapters.+ Fun game to play on multiplayer IF you find other players.+ X-ray killcam, same as in other Sniper Elite games.+ Trading Cards.Cons:- This is quite short game, just like NZA1 was, it takes like 5-10h to play whole the story of this game, depends on your settings.- Hard to find players in multiplayer, this game is almost as dead as NZA1. Ask other players to play with you on Steam Community Discussions.- Can't kick players from multiplayer games. Once on my team one player was afking 24mins and we couldn't do anything.- Doesn't have much nothing new when comparing to NZA1, only new chapters, not even new   guns.- Sometimes not so smoothly playable. Can be laggy too, and there are some glitches and bugs.- Can be boring when playing alone.Not worth of 14,99â¬, buy when it is -50% or -75%. Or just buy (on sale of course)  Zombie Army Trilogy, it's better.

Posted: January 8
												Left4Dead meets Sniper Elite. Played whole campaign in 4 players and it was quite enjoyable experience.But I wouldn't touch it solo, it would get boring pretty fast. Killing endless hordes of nazi zombies is always more fun with friends.Pros:- good coop game- WW2 setting (nazi zombies)- there is a serviceable story- dark art direction- few memorable moments- lot of shooting (preferably to head)Cons:- bad solo game- controls are clunky at first- a bit short and not very varied- no character progression or unlocks (might have been fun)- selection of weapons (they all feel the same)7/10 with friends, 4/10 solo. Get it cheap.

Posted: December 28, 2016
												This game is ment mainly for playing with friends. Ive only played solo but still enjoyed the game but it has its flawes. First, it has a lot of repetition. secound the kill shots are either uncommon instandard, or almost every other kill in increased. But the game has a great art style and has a wonderful atmosphere, the sound disign is good but i feel like the zombies yell too much for how slow they go. the story dosent stick too much for me but I only have a little over an hour of play at the time of righting this review. And i didnt play the first game. i would pick this game up on sell like i did for a little under 5 buck. the game is worth it at that price and make sure atleast you have one friend willing to play it with youfour broken zombie skulls out of five :)
